required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Intraoperative Neuromuscular Blockade on Postoperative Sore Throat and Hoarseness
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Intraoperative Neuromuscular Blockade on Postoperative Sore Throat and Hoarseness in Patients Undergoing Spinal Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators assess and compare postoperative sore throat and hoarseness in the group using the muscle relaxant and not using it during the operation.

detailed_description.textblock: The muscle relaxant is usually used during the operation to maintain moderate relaxation but, it can't be used in the surgery to need eletrophysiological monitoring during the operation. In this sturdy, the investigators assess the postoperative sore throat and hoarseness and compare the effect of muscle relaxant in the group using the muscle relaxant and not using it in terms of the incidence and severity of postoperative sore throat and hoarseness.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall cumulative incidence of postoperative sore throat
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 hr evaluation period after operation
primary_outcome.description: The incidence sore throat is assessed by the presence of sore throat

primary_outcome.measure: Overall cumulative incidence of postoperative hoarseness
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 hr evaluation period after operation
primary_outcome.description: The incidence sore throat is assessed by the degree of hoarseness

secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of sore throat is assessed by the presence of sore throat.
A 0âˆ’100 mm NRS is used to evaluate the severity of sore throat (0, no pain; 100, worst pain imaginable).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of postoperative hoarseness
secondary_outcome.description: Hoarseness is defined as a voice quality different from the preoperative voice and graded as follows: none (no hoarseness), mild (recognized by the patient), moderate (obvious to the investigator), and severe (aphonia).
the amount of patient-controlled analgesia and other analgesic medication consumed

arm_group.description: Rocuronium is used during the operation to maintain moderate relaxation.
Rocuronium is not used during the operation for the eletrophysiological monitoring.

intervention.description: In the group to need the eletrophysiological monitoring during the operation, we don't inject muscle relaxant except anestheitic induction.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients scheduled for elective lumbar spinal surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
- patients scheduled to undergo elective lumbar spinal surgery Exclusion criteria
- known or predicted difficult airway
- neuromuscular diseases
- hepatic or renal dysfunction
- diseases or anatomical abnormalities in the neck, larynx, or pharynx
- requirement for postoperative mechanical ventilation
